featured.text: The shuttle does not use its engines for a landing.
Astronauts sometimes go outside the shuttle to work.
Ground stations have been built to monitor larger pieces of space trash to prevent them from crashing into working satellites or space shuttles.
Also, astronauts conduct experiments on the shuttle to learn how space conditions, such as microgravity, affect humans, animals, plants, and insects.

other.text: Diapers are _(23)_ used by astronauts when they are outside the space shuttle, wearing a spacesuit.
When the shuttle touches the land, a drag parachute opens to steady the aircraft, get the speed right, and help the brakes on the landing-gear wheels to bring it to a complete stop. 49.
The passage is mainly about (A) how astronauts fly the space shuttle.
A parachute needs to be opened because it can (A) slow down the shuttle.
It may cause problems for space shuttles.
The astronauts need a space suit to work outside the shuttle.

definition.zh_def: 穿梭，指在兩地之間來回運送的人或物的交通工具或服務。
definition.en_def: A vehicle or service that travels back and forth between two places.
definition.example: The shuttle bus runs every 15 minutes between the airport and the hotel.
